verses.plain: The mighty God, even the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

tokens.t: The mighty God,
the
, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

verses.plain: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

tokens.t: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

verses.plain: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

tokens.t: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

verses.plain: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

tokens.t: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

verses.plain: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

tokens.t: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

verses.plain: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

tokens.t: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God
judge himself. Selah.

verses.plain: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

tokens.t: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I
God,
thy God.

verses.plain: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.

tokens.t: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings,
continually before me.

verses.plain: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.

tokens.t: I will take no bullock out of thy house,
he goats out of thy folds.

verses.plain: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

tokens.t: For every beast of the forest
mine,
the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.plain: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

tokens.t: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field
mine.

verses.plain: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

tokens.t: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world
mine, and the fulness thereof.

verses.plain: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

tokens.t: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

verses.plain: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

tokens.t: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

verses.plain: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

tokens.t: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

verses.plain: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

tokens.t: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or
thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

verses.plain: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

tokens.t: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

verses.plain: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

tokens.t: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

verses.plain: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

tokens.t: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

verses.plain: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.

tokens.t: Thou sittest
speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.

verses.plain: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

tokens.t: These
hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether
as thyself:
I will reprove thee, and set
in order before thine eyes.

verses.plain: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

tokens.t: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear
in pieces, and
none to deliver.

verses.plain: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.

tokens.t: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth
conversation
will I shew the salvation of God.

footnotes.text: hast…: Heb. thy portion was with
that…: Heb. that disposeth his way
